snippet: Ever since what could be a part from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was found, just about every piece of flotsam on the island has attracted scrutiny.
abstract: St-Denis Journal; discovery of airplane wing piece that may have belonged to Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, which disappeared in 2014, on island of Reunion in Indian Ocean has attracted unaccustomed attention to secluded spot and prompted scrutiny of coastal debris; identity of wing part remains unconfirmed.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia; Nicola Clark from Paris; and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Ever since what could be a part from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was found, just about every piece of flotsam on the island has attracted scrutiny.

headline.print_headline: Intrigue of Missing Flight Washes Over Tiny Island
headline.main: Tiny Island of Réunion Awash in Intrigue Over Vanished Malaysian Plane
